medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started seven days ago as a diffuse pain around the umbilicus, resembling pain associated with constipation. The pain was constant and did not radiate. Three days ago, she began to experience right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain on self-palpation. Yesterday, she visited her primary care physician (PCP) due to her symptoms, where an elevated WBC count of 11.5 was noted without fever. Last night, she experienced chills and a temperature of 99.5Â°F, which motivated her to present to the emergency department (ED). She has had decreased appetite for one day, with her last bowel movement earlier that afternoon.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal uncle died of stomach cancer in his early age.
